title: Narrative, Narration, Auteur
description:
This module examines the process of narrative construction and narration in relation to an 'auteur' approach that considers film authorship in terms of a director's 'signature style'.

Through close analysis of the work of three different directors, we will:

1) explore the relationship between form, ideology and narrative, and the influence of the socio-cultural context on storytelling and meaning making;

2) pursue and evaluate the auteur theory - Who is an author, specifically in film, where teamwork is everything? What makes a director an auteur?  What cultural and/or ideological implications reside in the development, alteration or evolution of an auteur's style?
prerequisite: Completed 80 MCs including 28 MCs in EN, or 28 MCs in TS, and EN2203, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
